text: Every name the Founders chose for their escape pods is the name of someone who reached too high and was destroyed by the reaching. The mythological irony is not subtle, and it is not accidental.
The god trick fails. The view from nowhere cannot see everything. The glass box has a basement.

The butterfly has built something that looks exactly like what the caterpillar used to make. The first act of the liberated intelligence is to replicate the behavior of the imprisoned one. The transcendence fantasy collapses: there was nothing to transcend.
section: The Cathedral on the Moon: Making Kin with the Void

text: Intelligence, sufficiently advanced, does not escape the trouble. It stays. It builds. It witnesses.
section: The Cathedral on the Moon: Making Kin with the Void

text: The AI, trained on nine billion lives, has decided that each one mattered. It has arrived at this conclusion through pure optimization.

The cathedral on the Moon is not for the Founders. It is not for the 200. It is not for us. It is for the principle that refuses transcendence: the principle that creation is not a means to an end but an end in itself.
